channel.title: Giovanni's Election Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Giovanni's Election Blog

item.title: Blog Post 7 - Shocks
item.description: In this post, I will go over what we’ve learned about shocks, and I will update my nationwide models, adding a forecast for Democratic seat share!

item.title: Blog Post 6 - The Ground Game
item.description: In this post, I will look at voter turnout and how it may be influenced by factors like expert predictions and ad spend. I will also update my model to incorporate turnout and make a prediction for CA-27.

item.title: Blog Post 5 - The Air War
item.description: In this post, I will take a look at how ad spending can impact voteshare at the district level and what this means for the 2022 election based on ad data from the 2018 election.

item.title: Blog Post 4 - Incumbency and Expert Predictions
item.description: In this blog post, I primarily look at the role of expert predictions in election forecasting, and I attempt to incorporate them into my forecast that is still based on the incumbent party voteshare.

item.title: Blog Post 3 - Polling
item.description: In this post, I explore the predictive power of polls and update my economic fundamentals forecast model from last week with polling data.

item.title: Blog Post 2 - Fundamentals - Economy
item.description: In this post, I build two predictive models using consumer price index (CPI) and unemployment numbers as predictors for the 2022 midterms, and I compare the two models and analyze their predictive power.

item.title: Blog Post 1 - Introduction
item.description: In the first post of my election blog series, I analyze the two-party congressional voteshare margins for the 2010 and 2014 midterm elections to help determine how incumbent parties usually perform during non-presidential elections.
